entry.tran: 南方的;在南部的;来自南部的
entry.def: Southern means in or from the south of a region, state, or country.

example.ex: The Everglades National Park stretches across the southern tip of Florida.
example.tran: 大沼泽地国家公园位于佛罗里达州的最南端。

example.ex: ...a place where you can sample southern cuisine.
example.tran: 可以品尝到南方美食的地方

means.word_mean: 1. in or characteristic of a region of the United States south of (approximately) the Mason-Dixon line;
2. situated in or oriented toward the south;
3. situated in or coming from regions of the south;
4. from the south; used especially of wind;

example.en: When Bob came home southern-fried, his wife nearly killed him.
example.zh: 当鲍勃喝得醉醺醺回家时,他妻子恨不得要杀死他。

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"……方向的"; 2. 表名词,"……场所"

stems_affixes.word_buile: east东+ern……方向的→adj.东方的,东部的
northeast东北+ern……方向的→adj.东北方的,来自东北的
north北+ern……方向的→adj.北方的,北部的
northwest西北+ern……方向的→adj.西北方的,来自西北的
south南+ern……方向的→adj.南方的,南部的
southwest西南+ern……方向的→adj.西南的,来自西南的
west西+ern……方向的→adj.西方的,西部的
cist箱子+ern……场所→n.[抽水马桶的]贮水池
lect讲话+ern……场所→n.[教堂中的]诵经台

sentences.en: He has traveled in southern cities.

jushi.english: They conquered the southern part of the kingdom with comparative ease.

jushi.english: Australia is in the southern part hemisphere.
Australia is in the southern part of the world.
jushi.chinese: 澳大利亚在世界的南方。
